title: Draft Report Offers Starkest View Yet of U.S. Climate Threats
description: “The things Americans value most are at risk,” says a draft of the National Climate Assessment, a major federal scientific report slated for release next year.
dc:creator: Brad Plumer and Raymond Zhong
media:description: A home destroyed by the Marshall fire in Louisville, Colo., in December. The United States has warmed 68 percent faster than Earth as a whole over the past 50 years, according to a draft scientific report.
